page.title: 10SCHOOL HASELOR, WARKS.
page.content: At school we have adopted the charity Action Research for the Crippled Child as the charity we support. Over the last few years we have raised between Â£100 and Â£400 a year.Every Autumn Term we elected officers for the Action Committee from the 4th year pupils. We hold meetings to decide what events we will hold to raise money for Action. When we have decided we ask Miss Fox if we can go ahead to arrange them.If possible we do everything ourselves but,of course,we have to have adult help for such things as barbecues.Most years we have a Hallow E'en party or disco,we dress up as witches,wizards or cats etc. Once we had a Sponsored Backwards Walk.We have a sponsored events. During the Summer Term we have a 'Penny Party' when we run sideshows and sell things we have made,but it is really a 3p now because of inflation.
